text: Jim 'Bucky' Mutscheller (March 31, 1930 â€“ April 10, 2015) was an American football player. He played tight end for nine seasons for the Baltimore Colts. He was born in Beaver Falls, Pennsylvania. Mutscheller played football, basketball, and baseball at Beaver Falls High School, and three seasons of varsity football at Notre Dame under coach Frank Leahy from 1949 to 1951, including on the 1949 national championship team. Mutscheller played both defensive end and offense for the Fighting Irish, and served as team captain his senior year. Mutscheller died of kidney failure in Towson, Maryland, aged 85. ==References== ==Other websites== * Klingaman, Mike. title: Jim Mutscheller
